Body: I just got a Samsung Galaxy 2 from Docomo in Japan.The only thing I don't like about it is that it came with about a million pre-installed apps, 99% of which are just garbage that clutter my application list. I'm not just talking about a few that I don't like, I'm talking about so many that I have to scroll through pages to get at the apps I want.I was unable to uninstall a handful by going to the Market and simply opting to uninstall.However, with all the rest, the uninstall button is greyed out.Can I remove these apps without rooting the phone, and if so how?If I have to root the phone, is that possible with my model?
Title: Can I remove all these garbage apps without rooting the phone?

history.Text: I just got a Samsung Galaxy 2 from Docomo in Japan.The only thing I don't like about it is that it came with about a million pre-installed apps, 99% of which are just garbage that clutter my application list. I'm not just talking about a few that I don't like, I'm talking about so many that I have to scroll through pages to get at the apps I want.I was unable to uninstall a handful by going to the Market and simply opting to uninstall.However, with all the rest, the uninstall button is greyed out.Can I remove these apps without rooting the phone, and if so how?If I have to root the phone, is that possible with my model?
